alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 06 at 1:35PM PST until November 07 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Significant snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 12 inches. The highest amounts will occur on the higher peaks of eastern Curry and western Josephine counties. The Snow level will fall to 3500 feet late this afternoon, down to as low as 2000 feet early Monday morning then rise to around 3500 feet during Monday. * WHERE...The higher terrain of eastern Curry County and Josephine County and Jackson County. This includes the peak of Highway 227 between Tiller and Trail, the vicinity of Prospect and Butte Falls, and the Kalmiopsis Wilderness. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will be most intense late this afternoon through this evening, and Monday morning into Monday afternoon. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
